info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 4:53AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...LIGHT ACCUMULATING WET SNOW CONTINUES INTO EARLY THIS MORNING... Light wet snow will continue to fall across portions of the eastern Catskills, mid Hudson Valley, southern Taconics, southern Berkshires and Litchfield Hills early this morning. The snow will end from west to east between 6 and 8 am. Generally a coating to an inch of snow will accumulate, with localized amounts of 1 to 2 inches in higher terrain areas. Most snow accumulations should be on grassy and elevated surfaces due to the initially warm ground temperatures, but there is potential for untreated roads and bridges to become slick heading into the morning commute with temperatures around freezing.
